alert.note: Alert for Hendry (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 20 at 5:09PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Collier and northwestern Hendry Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 509 PM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a funnel cloud 7 miles southwest of Felda, or 7 miles northwest of Immokalee, moving southwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Funnel clouds and winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Funnel clouds occasionally touch down and produce tornadoes or waterspouts. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Ave Maria, Immokalee, Felda, Big Corkscrew Island, Corkscrew Swamp Sanctuary, Keri, Bunker Hill and Lake Trafford. FUNNEL CLOUD...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes. Funnel clouds occasionally touch down and produce tornadoes or waterspouts. Move indoors and stay away from windows.
